intro: Galactites pumilus, commonly known as the dwarf milkweed, is a small, herbaceous plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family and is characterized by its slender, branching stems and small, clustered leaves. The plant produces showy, yellow-orange flowers that bloom in summer, attracting various pollinators. Its milky sap, which is toxic, is a distinguishing feature of the genus Galactites. Galactites pumilus typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is adapted to arid environments.
